investigatorQuestion.text: Multiple witnesses say they saw you arguing with the victim that week. What was that about?

maskAnswers.playerLine: It was a minor disagreement about project deadlines. I can provide documentation of our professional correspondence.

lowTension.text: Witnesses described it as heated, not minor.
You're deflecting. What were you really fighting about?

highTension.text: Deadlines can be stressful. I understand.
Work disagreements happen. Was it resolved?
Professional conflicts are normal. Go on.

maskAnswers.playerLine: We had a misunderstanding. I said things I didn't mean. I wish I could take it back now...

lowTension.text: What things? What did you say exactly?
Regret is interesting. What are you regretting?

highTension.text: We all say things we regret sometimes.
That's understandable. What was the topic?
Arguments happen. It doesn't mean anything.

maskAnswers.playerLine: People argue! It doesn't mean I killed anyone! This is ridiculous!

lowTension.text: No one said anything about killing. Interesting leap.
Your temper is showing again. Was it like this that night?
Defensive reactions suggest something to hide.

highTension.text: You're right, arguments aren't proof of anything.
I understand your frustration. Let's continue.
Fair enough. But I still need details.

maskAnswers.playerLine: You know how it is, Detective. Two passionate people, strong opinions. We always made up afterward. It was just our dynamic.

lowTension.text: A dynamic that ended in death? Interesting.
Passion can turn violent. Did it?

highTension.text: I understand. Some people just communicate differently.
Fair enough. It takes all kinds.
As long as it was just words. Continue.
